intro: Microlicia pseudoscoparia, commonly known as the false mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as an herb or shrub, characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. Its botanical features include hairy stems and capsules as its fruiting structures. It is often found in moist, shaded environments and is valued for its ornamental qualities.
